Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division

did.head: Collection Summary

descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English, with Spanish

did.abstract: Author, editor, and poet. Correspondence, writings, minutes, scrapbooks, printed matter, and miscellaneous items pertaining chiefly to Croffut's publications, activities with the Anti-Imperialist League, and the presidential campaign of 1900. Includes material relating to Ethan Allen Hitchcock, copies of correspondence with Sophia Amelia Peabody Hawthorne, wife of Nathaniel Hawthorne, journals of Henry Alfred Robbins, letters of John Quincy Adams and Jefferson Davis, and autograph material.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

persname.part: Croffut, W. A. (William Augustus), 1835-1915. "Now I recollect--souvenirs of the sanctum" ; "Lincoln as I saw him." 1943.
Hitchcock, Ethan Allen, 1798-1870. Fifty years in camp and field; diary of Major-General Ethan Allen Hitchcock. 1909.
Robbins, Henry Alfred, 1839-1911. Henry Alfred Robbins journals. 1870-1904.

corpname.part: Anti-Imperialist League (Washington, D.C.). Anti-Imperialist League (Washington, D.C.) records. 1899-1908.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of W. A. Croffut, author, editor, and poet, were deposited in the Library of Congress by his wife, Bessie B. Croffut between 1930 and 1934. In 1938 the material was converted to a gift and purchase by the Library.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Croffut Papers were processed in 1963. The finding aid was revised in 2012.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related collections in the Manuscript Division include the papers of Ethan Allen Hitchcock .

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings of W. A. Croffut is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of W. A. Croffut are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, W. A. Croffut Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Private, First Minnesota Regiment, during the Civil War, and field reporter for the New York Times
Executive officer, United States Geological Survey
Wrote opening ode for World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, Ill.
Campaigned in behalf of William Jennings Bryan for president

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers of William Augustus Croffut (1835-1915) contain correspondence, journals, scrapbooks, autographs, reference material, printed matter, and drafts of articles, books, and poems, including a significant portion relating to Ethan Allan Hitchcock. The collection spans the period 1774-1933, with the bulk of the material concentrated between 1880 and 1915. The papers are organized into five series: General Correspondence , Business Papers , Ethan Allen Hitchcock File , Anti-Imperialist League , and Miscellany .

The General Correspondence ranges from 1862 to 1933, with the largest part from the period 1880-1915. Correspondence after 1915 is largely that of Croffut's second wife, Bessie B. Croffut. Topics include Croffut's various publications, his activities with the Anti-Imperialist League, and the presidential campaign of 1900. Correspondents include George S. Boutwell, Elwood S. Corser, John William Hayes, John B. Henderson, Patrick O'Farrell, Bertrand Shadwell, Charles A. Towne, George W. Van Siclen, and Erving Winslow, as well prominent figures such as William Jennings Bryan, Samuel Gompers, and Carl Schurz.

The Ethan Allen Hitchcock File contains drafts and copies of Croffut's writings as well as a copy of Hitchcock's memoir that Croffut used for
Fifty Years in Field and Camp. This memoir, based on diaries, is not in the Ethan Allen Hitchcock collection in the Manuscript Division. Bessie B. Croffutt, niece of Hitchcock, also made copies of other Hitchcock materials, including correspondence with Sophie Peabody (Mrs. Nathaniel Hawthorne). Also in the collection are an undated letter of John Quincy Adams, a note of Jefferson Davis, numerous autographs, including of James Monroe, copies of George Washington material, and items relating to Joseph Smith Fowler.

Included in the Anti-Imperialist League file are minutes and records of the Washington, D.C., branch, along with other branch and league literature, additional printed matter, and drafts of articles advocating the cause of the Philippines and of the Boers in South Africa. The Miscellany series includes journals of Henry Alfred Robbins containing accounts of his travels in Europe that describe practices on the Continent during the 1870s. Scrapbooks contain newspaper columns and an account of the World's Columbian Exposition of 1893 in Chicago.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in five series:

scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received, including correspondence of Croffut's second wife, Bessie B. Croffut.

Mainly copies of Hitchcock's memoir and related notes and correspondence relating to its publication by Croffut. Also other writings by Croffut and Croffut family members, including drafts, galleys, printed articles and verse, and books of poetry by Croffut.

did.unittitle: Letters to Sophia Amelia Peabody Hawthorne
Draft of article on European trip
Drafts of articles and verse by Croffut family
Printed articles and verse by Croffut family

scopecontent.p: Official minutes and other records of the league's Washington, D.C., branch, drafts of articles on the Philippines and imperialism, and printed matter relating to the league and to imperialism, South Africa, and the Boers.

did.unittitle: Official minutes and other records, Washington, D.C., branch
Drafts of articles on Philippines and imperialism

scopecontent.p: Autographs and copies of letters of historical figures, address books, notebooks, journals of Henry Alfred Robbins, scrapbooks, maps, bibliographic data, printed matter, and miscellaneous items.

did.unittitle: Copies of letters of George Washington and Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna and printed matter, 1774-1850
Autograph book and autographs, including of James Monroe, John Quincy Adams (letter of Apr. 15, no year), and Jefferson Davis (note of 1853), circa 1830-circa 1910
Herndon, William Henry, letter to Joseph Smith Fowler, 1889
White, Hugh Lawson, regarding election to presidency, 1835
Judge advocate's journal and vouchers and letters of Joseph Smith Fowler, 1862-1867
Journals of Henry Alfred Robbins recounting travel in Europe, 1870-1904
Unmarked notebook of Bessie B. Croffut
